prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions: Create a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Create a new coordinate system The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. We will begin by creating a new coordinate system. The Euler Angles for this coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. This means the 2D sketch plane will be rotated -90 degrees around the z-axis. The Translation Vector for this coordinate system is [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This means the 2D sketch plane will be translated by 0.75 units in the positive y-direction. Create a 2D sketch on the xy-plane Switch to the sketching environment and create a new sketch on the xy-plane. Draw the rectangular prism's boundary We will now draw the boundary of the rectangular prism. 1. Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.0). This is line 1. 2. Draw a line from point (0.375, 0.0) to point (0.375, 0.375). This is line 2. 3. Draw a line from point (0.375, 0.375) to point (0.75, 0.375). This is line 3. 4. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.375) to point (0.75, 0.75). This is line 4. 5. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.75) to point (0.0, 0.75). This is line 5. 6. Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.75) to point (0.0, 0.0). This is line 6. Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch, using a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Now, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation and translation defined earlier. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Finally, we will extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis to generate the 3D model. Extrude with a depth of 0.75 units in the positive z-direction. This results in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Height: 0.75 Width: 0.75 Length: 0.75</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.0],"End Point":[0.375,0.375]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.375],"End Point":[0.75,0.375]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.375],"End Point":[0.75,0.75]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}

Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. - Euler angles: X=0°, Y=0°, Z=-90° - Translation vector: (0, 0.5, 0) 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.5 units. The length of this part is 0.75, width is 0.5, and height is 0.75, reflecting its rounded rectangular prism shape.</description>

Set the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` to 0.75 and `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` to 0.0. 4. Set the `sketch_scale` to 0.125. 5. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for `operation`. **Part 2 Instructions:** Construct the three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and a cylindrical hole in the center.
